summary: In 2017, 3 hurricanes struck Florida, Texas, and Puerto Rico, causing severe damage and deaths. States and territories are responsible for identifying disaster-related deaths. Initially, Puerto Rico had reported 65 deaths directly related to Hurricane Maria, but later revised the official count to 2,975. Puerto Rico officials said damaged roads, power outages, and shortages of medical examiner staff and equipment initially made it harder to...
title: Disaster Response: Federal Assistance and Selected States and Territory Efforts to Identify Deaths from 2017 Hurricanes
